channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4453] Obama wins 2009 Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: US President Barack Obama is announced as the winner of the 2009 Nobel Peace Prize.

item.title: [+2199] Absurd decision on Obama makes mockery of Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The award of this year’s Nobel peace prize to President Obama will be met with widespread incredulity, consternation in many capitals and probably deep embarrassment by the President himself. Rarely has an award had such an obvious political and partisan intent.

item.title: [+1805] In The Matter Of...WTF, Your Hot Coffee Is Actually Hot!
item.description: "How-To" sign at a coffee shop and the ridiculous, pathetic (and increasingly familiar?) story behind it. Remember, when you pour your hot coffee, best not to pour it over your head....

item.title: [+1511] Dugg for Truth [PIC]
item.description: Your car sounds like it's broken, thanks for bursting my ear drums.

item.title: [+1334] Glenn Beck Is Stealing Colbert's Schtick
item.description: Stephen Colbert compares footage of himself with that of Glenn Beck to demonstrate how similar they are.

item.title: [+1061] I have Got Something Interesting in this Photo...[PIC]
[+1038] 5 Websites During The Zombie Apocalypse
item.description: Facebook, F My Life, Twitter, Digg, and Texting during a zombie apocalypse? Say it ain't so! Ehh, we can't.

item.title: [+999] The ER removed this splinter from patient Foot
[+996] Exclusive! Yahoo Provided Iran with Names of 200,000 Users
item.description: Yahoo collaborated with the Iranian regime during the election protests, providing to the authorities the names and emails of some 200,000 Iranian Yahoo users.

item.title: [+831] Oklahoma will publicly post details of all abortions online
item.description: On Nov. 1, a law in Oklahoma will go into effect that will collect personal details about every single abortion performed in the state and post them on a public website. Implementing the measure will “cost $281,285 the first year and $256,285 each subsequent year.” Here are the first eight questions that women will have to reveal:

item.title: [+756] Hulu Releases A Linux Hulu Desktop Client!
item.description: Hulu Desktop for Linux is currently built on Fedora 11 and Ubuntu 9.04. The packages should also work on any Linux distribution with glib2.16 (such as Ubuntu 8.04+ and Fedora 9+). Other configurations have not been tested.

item.title: [+754] Obama humiliated by IOC plot
item.description: The International Olympic Committee had already decided not to choose Chicago even before President Obama came to Copenhagen.

item.title: [+719] This Is Not Your Ordinary Family Photo
item.description: This is probably the most extraordinary family photo you will ever see in a long time. Not for the photo itself, but from where is currently resting...

item.title: [+659] Mugging of Seth Green Footage Before Freak-Out Scene (VIDEO)
[+629] The Greatest Story Ever Told
item.description: This guy has a very reasonable explanation on how he ended up here.

item.title: [+605] Colbert vs. Conservapedia (Video)
item.description: You can't have a conservative Bible without Stephen Colbert, so last night, he called on viewers to edit Conservapedia's wiki Bible to include him as a Biblical figure. The site has since responded.

item.title: [+566] Woman Loses Marathon Title For Wearing iPod During Race
item.description: Want to run for 26.2 miles and get nothing in return? There's an app for that.

item.title: [+562] Marge Simpson is November's Playboy Covergirl
item.description: You heard it right. Marge Simpson will be undressing somewhere in November's Playboy issue. Nerds rejoice!

item.title: [+539] Microsoft and Google are the good guys, Apple not so much
item.description: Now before all the Apple fan boys take a jab at this. Read this through. Anyone who likes competition and choice should root for Microsoft and Google. At the CTIA Wireless IT trade show this week, it's clear that these two mega-corps are enabling many more players to compete in the world of smartphones than just themselves.

item.title: [+503] Apparently, this is a problem in downtown Houston [PIC]
